messages.content: First, You will be provided entire response with html element. Second, You will be provided example code nested in tags.
Can you give me a example of using fetch to post in js

Sure, here's an example of using the `fetch` API in JavaScript to make a POST request:



const url = 'https://example.com/api/some-endpoint';
const data = { username: 'example' };

fetch(url, {
  method: 'POST',
  headers: {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json'
  },
  body: JSON.stringify(data)
})
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data))
  .catch(error => console.error(error));

In this example, `fetch` is used to make a POST request to `https://example.com/api/some-endpoint` with the payload `{ username: 'example' }`. The request headers specify that the request payload is JSON using the `Content-Type` header. The `then` function is called with the response object returned by the API, which is then converted to JSON using the `json` method. The resulting JSON data is logged to the console using `console.log`. Any errors that occur during the fetch request or data conversion are caught and logged to the console using `console.error`.
Can you give a example of using fetch with async and await
